connected.paragraph1: Welcome to the revolution! You are now a valuable part of the distributed web.

notConnected.header: Could not connect to the IPFS API
notConnected.paragraph1: <0>Check out the installation guide in the <1>IPFS Docs</1>, or try these common fixes:</0>
notConnected.paragraph2: <0>Is your IPFS daemon running? Try starting or restarting it from your terminal:</0>
notConnected.paragraph3: <0>Is your IPFS API configured to allow <1>cross-origin (CORS) requests</1>? If not, run these commands and then start your daemon from the terminal:</0>
notConnected.paragraph4: <0>Is your IPFS API on a port other than 5001? If your node is configured with a <1>custom API address</1>, enter it here to update your config file.</0>

aboutIpfs.paragraph1: <0><0>IPFS is a protocol</0> that defines a content-addressed file system, coordinates content delivery and combines ideas from Kademlia, BitTorrent, Git and more.</0>
aboutIpfs.paragraph2: <0><0>IPFS is a filesystem.</0> It has directories and files and mountable filesystem via FUSE.</0>
aboutIpfs.paragraph3: <0><0>IPFS is a web.</0> Files are accessible via HTTP gateways like <2>https://ipfs.io</2>. Browsers <4>can be extended</4> to use the <6>ipfs://</6> scheme directly, and hash-addressed content guarantees authenticity.</0>
aboutIpfs.paragraph4: <0><0>IPFS is p2p.</0> It supports worldwide peer-to-peer file transfers with a completely decentralized architecture and no central point of failure.</0>
aboutIpfs.paragraph5: <0><0>IPFS is a CDN.</0> Add a file to your local repository, and it's now available to the world with cache-friendly content-hash addressing and BitTorrent-like bandwidth distribution.</0>

welcomeInfo.header: In this app, you can â€¦
welcomeInfo.paragraph1: <0><0>Check your node status</0>, including how many peers you're connected to, your storage and bandwidth stats, and more</0>
welcomeInfo.paragraph2: <0><0>View and manage files</0> in your IPFS repo, including drag-and-drop file import, easy pinning, and quick sharing and download options</0>
welcomeInfo.paragraph3: <0><0>Visit the "Merkle Forest"</0> with some sample datasets and explore the IPLD data model that underpins how IPFS works</0>
welcomeInfo.paragraph4: <0><0>See who's connected to your node</0>, geolocated on a world map by their IP address</0>
welcomeInfo.paragraph5: <0><0>Review or edit your node settings</0> without needing to use the command line</0>
welcomeInfo.paragraph6: <0><0>Check this app's source code</0> to <2>report a bug</2> or make a contribution, and make IPFS better for everyone!</0>
